      • pure

        boolean pure()
        Is this scope a 'pure' scope, pure in the sense of pure functions. Pure scopes are created using the 'pure' operator.
        Returns:
        true if this is a pure scope

      • scopeForKey

        @Nullable
@Nullable Scope scopeForKey(@NotNull
                                      @NotNull String key)
        Find which ancestor scope, or this scope, that contains a variable with the name.
        Parameters:
        key - name of the variable.
        Returns:
        the Scope associated with the variable or null of none found

      • set

        @NotNull
@NotNull Variable set(@NotNull
                               @NotNull String key,
                               @NotNull
                               @NotNull var value,
                               @Nullable
                               @Nullable var constraint,
                               @Nullable
                               @Nullable String constraintSource,
                               @NotNull
                               @NotNull VarFlags varFlags)
        Creates or updates a variable.
        Parameters:
        key - the name of the variable
        value - the value to assign
        constraint - a constraint on this variable that will be checked on assignment
        constraintSource - an arbitrary string with a near one to one mapping with the source of the constraint
        varFlags - a set of flags relating to the variable
        Returns:
        the variable definition

@Nullable String source()

        Returns:
        the source code

        Returns:

      • variables

        @NotNull
@NotNull Map<String,Variable> variables()
        Returns all the variables in this scope, including parameter variables
        Returns:
        all variables in *this* scope
